repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
### vim-patch:ca7c9b1b5926,34b9a15c378f

omit (json formating plugin in vim9script)

### vim-patch:b52e7ac7c61c

runtime(netrw): Fix `w:netrw_bannercnt` ref error with `netrw_fastbrowse=2` (vim/vim#13659)

* NetRW: Fix `w:netrw_bannercnt` ref error with `netrw_fastbrowse=2`
* NetRW: Fix wrong `w:netrw_bannercnt` setting

closes: vim/vim#13640

https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/b52e7ac7c61cd88d04ee6b7b1808c361dd4a7640

Co-authored-by: KSR-Yasuda <31273423+KSR-Yasuda@users.noreply.github.com>

### vim-patch:5a68cdf14915

runtime(sbt): do not set b:did_ftplugin before sourcing scala ftplugin(vim/vim#13657)

The `b:did_ftplugin` guard was set and prevented us from actually sourcing `ftplugin/scala.vim`. Since the latter script also sets the guard properly, we can simply remove the guard here.

https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5a68cdf14915f20a1a6889cd0a76d29ecd374f24

Co-authored-by: Karl Yngve Lerv√•g <karl.yngve@lervag.net>

### vim-patch:f6869212c9e1

runtime(vim): Update syntax file (vim/vim#13653)

Improve variable highlighting in :let, :unlet, :const and :for commands.

Match registers and local, global and terminal option variables.

https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/f6869212c9e19ec8f2a4434732dd28f84f170163

Co-authored-by: dkearns <dougkearns@gmail.com>

comment_data.body: Not your fault, but probably missing a `:hi def link vimFor vimCommand`

+

comment_data.body: I don't think this is applicable. Unlike Vim, Nvim never respects 'fileignorecase' when matching filetype, because of Lua.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -245,6 +245,13 @@ function M.cpp(_, _)
   return vim.g.cynlib_syntax_for_cpp and 'cynlib' or 'cpp'
 end
 
+--- @type vim.filetype.mapfn
+function M.CH_fic(_, _)
+  if not vim.o.fileignorecase then

comment_data.body: Do you mean "it _shouldn't_ be applicable"? Because you can absolutely make it work if you want to.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -245,6 +245,13 @@ function M.cpp(_, _)
   return vim.g.cynlib_syntax_for_cpp and 'cynlib' or 'cpp'
 end
 
+--- @type vim.filetype.mapfn
+function M.CH_fic(_, _)
+  if not vim.o.fileignorecase then

comment_data.body:
The problem the patch was trying to solve is that `.h` files are still recognized as `cpp` when `g:c:syntax_for_h` and 'fileignorecase' is set.

Without this patch:
```sh
vim --clean --cmd 'let g:c_syntax_for_h = 1 | set fileignorecase' file.h
```
set `cpp` filetype, while
```sh
nvim --clean --cmd 'let g:c_syntax_for_h = 1 | set fileignorecase' file.h
```
already sets `c` filetype.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -245,6 +245,13 @@ function M.cpp(_, _)
   return vim.g.cynlib_syntax_for_cpp and 'cynlib' or 'cpp'
 end
 
+--- @type vim.filetype.mapfn
+function M.CH_fic(_, _)
+  if not vim.o.fileignorecase then

comment_data.body: And, with this patch and 'fileignorecase' but without `g:c_syntax_for_h`, Vim set `c` filetype for `.C` files and `cpp` filetype for `.H` files, while in this PR Nvim sets **no filetype at all** for `.C` and `.H` files when 'fileignorecase' is set.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -245,6 +245,13 @@ function M.cpp(_, _)
   return vim.g.cynlib_syntax_for_cpp and 'cynlib' or 'cpp'
 end
 
+--- @type vim.filetype.mapfn
+function M.CH_fic(_, _)
+  if not vim.o.fileignorecase then

comment_data.body: OK, I'll leave this one for you to handle then.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -245,6 +245,13 @@ function M.cpp(_, _)
   return vim.g.cynlib_syntax_for_cpp and 'cynlib' or 'cpp'
 end
 
+--- @type vim.filetype.mapfn
+function M.CH_fic(_, _)
+  if not vim.o.fileignorecase then

comment_data.body: TBH I don't know what to do either...

 end
 
+--- @type vim.filetype.mapfn

+  if not vim.o.fileignorecase then
